New Records: Mark Vientos' 12 RBIs tied the franchise record for a postseason with Curtis Granderson (2015) and John Olerud (1999)
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani launched Quintana's second pitch of the game over the right-field fence for his second homer in as many days.
Betts homered against Phil Maton in the sixth to bury the Mets in a 7-2 hole.
Edman's two-run double in the eighth and Will Smith's RBI single buried the Mets in a 10-2 hole.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza said, referring to his starting pitchers, 'We ask a lot out of these guys,' and 'We’re facing a good team.'
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo said, 'It’s very real, you lose one more game, you’re done.'
Pete Alonso said, 'I believe in this group … the character of this team.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets finished 0-for-10 with runners in scoring position. In the four games, they are 4-for-29 (.138) in that category. The Dodgers have outscored the Mets, 30-9, in the series.
Others: The Mets down 3-1 in the series, the mission is clear: Win three straight games against the Dodgers beginning with Friday’s Game 5 in Queens or start planning for spring training.
